Description: Enable cross-origin resource share filter.
A comma separated list of allowed origins that access the resources. The default value is *, which means all origins.
A comma separated list of allowed origins that time the resource. The default value is the empty string, which means no origins.
A comma separated list of allowed HTTP methods used when accessing the resources. The default values are GET, POST, HEAD, and DELETE.

A comma separated list of HTTP allowed headers specified when accessing the resources. The default value is X-Requested-With,Content-Type,Accept,Origin. If the value is a single *, it accepts all headers.
The number of seconds to cache preflight requests by the client. The default value is 1800 seconds or 30 minutes.
A boolean indicating if the resource allows requests with credentials. The default value is true.
A comma separated list of allowed HTTP headers exposed on the client. The default value is the empty list.
If true chained preflight requests for normal handling (as an OPTION request). Otherwise, the filter responds to the preflight. The default is true.
Enables HTTPS.
The HTTPS port number of the Jetty web server.
Path to the key store file.
Password to the key store.
The type to the key store.
Manager password to the key store.
TLS protocol to use. The JVM must support the TLS protocol to use.
The collection of enabled cipher algorithms.
Enables the authentication of the client.
Path to the trust store file.
Required: Yes if use HTTPS and the authentication of client

Description: Password to the trust store.
Required: Yes if use HTTPS and the authentication of client

Description: The type to the trust store.

The classpath of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service; includes the directory containing jars and configuration. It supports both absolute and relative paths, for example, iceberg-rest-server/libs, iceberg-rest-server/conf
The host of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service.
The port of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service.
The minimum number of threads in the thread pool used by the Jetty web server. minThreads is 8 if the value is less than 8.
The maximum number of threads in the thread pool used by the Jetty web server. maxThreads is 8 if the value is less than 8, and maxThreads must be greater than or equal to minThreads.
The size of the queue in the thread pool used by Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service.
The amount of time in ms for the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service to stop gracefully. For more information, see org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server#setStopTimeout.
The timeout in ms of idle connections.
The maximum size of an HTTP request.
The maximum size of an HTTP response.
Comma-separated list of filter class names to apply to the APIs.

The type of authentication for Iceberg rest catalog backend. This configuration only applicable for for Hive backend, and only supports Kerberos, simple currently. As for JDBC backend, only username/password authentication was supported now.
Whether to enable impersonation for the Iceberg catalog
Whether to enable SASL authentication protocol when connect to Kerberos Hive metastore.
Required: No, This value should be true in most case(Some will use SSL protocol, but it rather rare) if the value of gravitino.iceberg-rest.authentication.type is Kerberos.

Description: The principal of the Kerberos authentication
Required: required if the value of gravitino.iceberg-rest.authentication.type is Kerberos.

Description: The URI of The keytab for the Kerberos authentication.
Required: required if the value of gravitino.iceberg-rest.authentication.type is Kerberos.

Description: The check interval of Kerberos credential for Iceberg catalog.
The fetch timeout of retrieving Kerberos keytab from authentication.kerberos.keytab-uri.
The IO implementation for FileIO in Iceberg, use org.apache.iceberg.aws.s3.S3FileIO for S3.

An alternative endpoint of the S3 service, This could be used for S3FileIO with any s3-compatible object storage service that has a different endpoint, or access a private S3 endpoint in a virtual private cloud.
The region of the S3 service, like us-west-2.
Whether to use path style access for S3.
The IO implementation for FileIO in Iceberg, use org.apache.iceberg.aliyun.oss.OSSFileIO for OSS.
The endpoint of Aliyun OSS service.
The region of the OSS service, like oss-cn-hangzhou, only used when credential-providers is oss-token.
The io implementation for FileIO in Iceberg, use org.apache.iceberg.gcp.gcs.GCSFileIO for GCS.
The IO implementation for FileIO in Iceberg, use org.apache.iceberg.azure.adlsv2.ADLSFileIO for ADLS.
The IO implementation for FileIO in Iceberg, please use the full qualified classname.
The Catalog backend of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service. Use the value hive for a Hive catalog.
The Hive metadata address, such as thrift://127.0.0.1:9083.
The warehouse directory of the Hive catalog, such as /user/hive/warehouse-hive/.
The catalog backend name passed to underlying Iceberg catalog backend. Catalog name in JDBC backend is used to isolate namespace and tables.
Default value: hive for Hive backend, jdbc for JDBC backend, memory for memory backend

Description: The Catalog backend of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service. Use the value jdbc for a JDBC catalog.
The JDBC connection address, such as jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432 for Postgres, or jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/ for mysql.
The warehouse directory of JDBC catalog. Set the HDFS prefix if using HDFS, such as hdfs://127.0.0.1:9000/user/hive/warehouse-jdbc
The catalog name passed to underlying Iceberg catalog backend. Catalog name in JDBC backend is used to isolate namespace and tables.
The username of the JDBC connection.
The password of the JDBC connection.
Whether to initialize the meta tables when creating the JDBC catalog.
com.mysql.jdbc.Driver or com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver for MySQL, org.postgresql.Driver for PostgreSQL.
The Catalog backend of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service. Use the value custom for a Custom catalog.
The fully-qualified class name of a custom catalog implementation, only worked if catalog-backend is custom.
The schema version of JDBC catalog backend, setting to V1 if supporting view operations.

The className of catalog configuration provider, Gravitino provides build-in static-config-provider and dynamic-config-provider, you could also develop a custom class that implements apache.gravitino.iceberg.service.provider.IcebergConfigProvider and add the corresponding jar file to the Iceberg REST service classpath directory.
The uri of Gravitino server address, only worked if catalog-config-provider is dynamic-config-provider.
The metalake name that dynamic-config-provider used to request to Gravitino, only worked if catalog-config-provider is dynamic-config-provider.
Catalog cache eviction interval.
The client pool size of the catalog.
The Iceberg metrics storage class name.
The days to retain Iceberg metrics in store, the value not greater than 0 means retain forever.
The size of queue to store metrics temporally before storing to the persistent storage. Metrics will be dropped when queue is full.
Comma-separated list of Iceberg REST API packages to expand.
